title: November comScore Numbers Show USA TODAY NETWORK’s Continued Digital Growth
text:
CLOSE

USA TODAY NETWORK (Photo: USA TODAY NETWORK)

USA TODAY NETWORK continues to serve as a leader in digital media, according to comScore’s most recent data.

Comprised of USA TODAY and more than 100 local newsrooms, the network saw 125MM unique visitors during the month of November, an increase from its October numbers. This growth is up 2.3% from November 2016 data.

The gaining presence of mobile continues to prove strong as mobile visitors were up 28% from last year. November also marks the first month of Grateful Digital included in the network’s audience. Serving as the brand’s lifestyle site, Grateful Digital reached 9M unique visitors throughout the month.

Local sites continued to be the main driver of month to month and year-over-year growth, acquiring 46.5M unique visitors throughout November. Leading local sites in year-over-year growth include The Desert Sun, the York Daily Record, and the Tallahassee Democrat (83%).

As a whole, the network maintained its #3 ranking in comScore’s News/Information category. Top stories from the month include the following:

Army says USA TODAY story forced it to drop plans for waivers for high-risk recruits

Taxpayers pay legal bill to protect Trump business profits

Sexual harassment troubles mount in statehouses around the country

Woman who reported rape says TripAdvisor lied about apologizing to her for deleting post

Black Friday and Cyber Monday survival guide 2017

Moore calls latest accusation 'absolutely false'

Read or Share this story: https://usat.ly/2pgspI3
